thread.title: Apple plans to introduce a new AI-focused chip to its fleet of Macs
thread.title_full: Apple plans to introduce a new AI-focused chip to its fleet of Macs

author: Francisco Velasquez
title: Apple plans to introduce a new AI-focused chip to its fleet of Macs
text:
Apple is gearing up to introduce a new chip processor to its fleet of Macs in an effort to boost waning computer sales and spotlight AI.
Bloomberg, citing people familiar with the matter who asked to remain anonymous, said the company may soon
start producing the M4 processor, adding that the chip would come in three main varieties. Apple, which has not announced the plans, wants every Mac model to have the chip update, the publication added.
Apple is considering a launch of the updated computers by the end of 2024 and into the beginning of 2025. The new in-house processing chip also comes at a time when Mac’s sales have declined. During the 2023 fiscal year,
Mac sales decreased by 27%. Talks of the new chip come shortly after the company introduced its trio of M3 chips last October.
The new chip comes
as Apple gets more ambitious with its AI goals. The company has quietly outpaced others like Amazon, Microsoft, and Google in terms of AI deals. That AI-effort will extend to Apple’s iPhone processors, which it plans to upgrade this year.
Apple shares
climbed during afternoon hours on Thursday, trading at $175. That rise marked Apple’s best day since May of 2023.
